definition[0]: someone who is modest does not want to talk about their abilities or achievements
example[0]: You’re too modest! You’ve been a huge help to us.
example[1]: He was always modest about his role in the Everest expedition.
definition[1]: not very great, big, or expensive
example[3]: She had saved a modest amount of money.
example[4]: The new service proved a modest success.
example[5]: a modest house with a small garden
definition[2]: shy about showing your body or attracting sexual interest, because you are easily embarrassed
example[7]: She was a modest girl, always keeping covered, even in summer.
definition[3]: modest clothing covers the body in a way that does not attract sexual interest
definition[4]: not wanting to talk about your abilities or achievements and to say that you are good at something, even when you are – used to show approval
example[9]: Miller, a quiet, modest man, gave credit to Asher for the initial discovery.
example[10]: She was surprisingly modest about her own achievements as a player.
definition[5]: not wanting to talk about yourself or to attract attention
example[11]: Her husband was a quiet, self-effacing man who spent much of his time in his study.
definition[6]: not wanting to be noticed and not expecting to be treated in a special way
example[12]: By now Chapman was famous, but he remained as unassuming as ever.
example[13]: He then began, in typically unassuming fashion, to establish the first modern dance company.
definition[7]: believing that you are not more important, better, or cleverer than other people, and therefore not expecting to be treated in a special way
example[14]: A good leader is humble enough to get advice from experts.
definition[8]: not trying to seem better than other people, even if you are rich, famous, clever etc
example[15]: President Eisenhower was a friendly and unpretentious man who seemed to embody American virtues.
example[16]: It's his unpretentious boyish charm that ensures Jackie Chan's position as one of the giants of international cinema.
definition[9]: behaving or talking about your own abilities or achievements in a way that makes them seem unimportant
example[17]: Despite his intellect, he had an appealing self-deprecating humour.
example[18]: The nice thing about him is his self-deprecating manner. His intellectual ability was never pushed at you, yet he obviously had great potential.
